meanings.definition: The act of selling goods door-to-door.
meanings.sent1: The pedlery in our neighborhood brings convenience to our doorstep.
meanings.sent2: She made a living through pedlery, going from house to house with her products.
meanings.sent3: The pedlery salesman accidentally knocked on the wrong door and tried to sell a vacuum to a cat.
meanings.sent4: His pedlery was like a traveling treasure chest, offering surprises at every stop.
meanings.sent5: The colorful pedlery display caught the eye of every passerby.

meanings.definition: The goods sold by a peddler.
meanings.sent1: The pedlery he carried in his cart included toys, snacks, and trinkets.
meanings.sent2: Customers were always curious about the new pedlery the vendor had in stock.
meanings.sent3: The pedlery items spilled out of the vendor's bag, creating a colorful mess on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent4: Her pedlery of handmade soaps and candles was a hit at the local market.
meanings.sent5: The pedlery on display ranged from practical tools to whimsical decorations.

meanings.definition: The occupation or business of a peddler.
meanings.sent1: Pedlery requires a lot of walking and interacting with customers.
meanings.sent2: She decided to pursue pedlery as a full-time job after seeing its potential.
meanings.sent3: The peddler's pedlery took him to different towns, offering his wares to all.
meanings.sent4: In the world of pedlery, building relationships with clients is key to success.
meanings.sent5: The art of pedlery involves knowing what products will appeal to different customers.
